name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"d03deace-1ed9-45ad-a2ab-5273b70fce2e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: visit_Raise","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"60163eff-6bbc-4eab-919d-c0e4a8b80713","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_Raise","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is responsible for analyzing explicit exception-raising statements in Python (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"raise ValueError("Invalid input")","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). While raising an exception stops normal execution, from a static analysis perspective, it represents an important link between the current function and the Exception classes it utilizes. This function tracks these dependencies.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9acc811c-8fc5-4022-b64a-d290e73c1578","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"29a8f702-a161-49f2-ab99-cd01d30dc3d1","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Dependency Tracking:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Exceptions are classes just like any other. If ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module_a","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" raises an exception defined in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module_b","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", that creates a hard dependency. The analyzer must record this relationship in the Call Graph (CG) so that tools visualizing the architecture can see that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module_a","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" depends on ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module_b","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"db0e4334-8258-4083-9a53-d638063b53e4","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Constructor Logic:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Raising an exception usually involves instantiating a class (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ValueError(...)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). This invokes the exception's ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__init__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method. The analyzer needs to simulate this instantiation to ensure any arguments passed to the exception are tracked correctly.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"83cd7d3d-0cdb-4127-8bf1-0a1b8536211f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"319835f2-4d1c-4367-beec-d51cca491864","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Validation:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It first checks if the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"raise","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" statement actually has an exception attached (bare ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"raise","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" statements inside ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"except","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" blocks re-raise the active exception and are skipped here).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"02413be4-4d6f-4b57-b28a-787a9efd4075","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Resolution:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It "visits" and "decodes" the exception expression (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ValueError","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") to find the actual Definition object corresponding to that class.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"84b72f07-01fb-4df5-a428-13a82bde7e41","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Class Initialization:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"f98b4fd6-3792-4105-b289-f6c3ff07c726","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It checks if the resolved definition is a Class (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CLS_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fa8ad59d-382b-42b4-9e84-32b7cc56f033","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It finds the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__init__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method for that Exception class.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d28f9bc5-705e-4c0e-b5ba-5f265433955b","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It temporarily "pushes" that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__init__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method onto the stack. This signals to the analyzer that "Function X is effectively calling Exception.","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"init","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"," ensuring parameter tracking works properly.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"63806cd1-ef1f-43af-91d3-a840a684d030","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"External Dependencies:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If the exception is defined externally (e.g., in a third-party library or standard library, marked as ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"EXT_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), it explicitly adds an edge to the Call Graph (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"cg","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") linking the current scope to that external exception name.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e86d2dfb-a88b-4315-8384-9e3cd4f4b652","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Code:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"66fc76c4-af79-4c36-bc9f-b15a96447fd1","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"def check_user(user):
    if not user:
        raise auth_lib.AuthError("User missing")","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7b332fa3-c7c9-49d8-9df1-183d197976db","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Analysis:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3bb52218-b9df-4893-9888-57992851cf0e","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_Raise","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" examines ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"auth_lib.AuthError","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1e201a5a-16f4-4d31-adab-51b03b946d94","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It resolves this to the class definition ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"auth_lib.AuthError","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b9ff7129-3914-43c6-b02e-27106eb1eeb1","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It finds ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"auth_lib.AuthError.__init__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4e97447c-6e6c-4fca-beab-d504f38e93b0","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It registers a usage of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__init__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ensuring the string "User missing" is associated with that constructor.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"364d15a9-cc62-41c3-bbad-6cc4c7c616df","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"auth_lib","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is external, it draws a dependency line from ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"check_user","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"auth_lib.AuthError","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7b707cd3-d83d-4e01-8891-7881b30bf508","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
